section.name: CAUTION
section.p: The following is well out of date. Take with a pinch of salt until it is re-written

subsection.name: Externals
subsection.p:
These are the environments under which JES was developed:
Java sdk j2sdk1.4.1_02
Tomcat 4.1.24
Axis-1_1

subsection.name: The Jes War file
subsection.p: Contains all the runtime files required for JES apart from the external prerequisites.

section.name: Deploying the War file
section.p: Tomcat must be installed and running in order to achieve this step. Copy the jes war file into the Tomcat webapps directory. Tomcat will automatically deploy the war file, creating the following directory structure under the webapps directory...
At the same time, the JES web services will be deployed automatically.

section.name: 3.0 The JES Database
section.p: A Job database is required to keep track of jobs entered into the AstroGrid system. MySQL or a similar relational database is required.

section.name: JNDI
section.p:
JES uses JNDI to lookup it's associated database. One file requires altering to enable this to happen:
The Tomcat SERVER.XML file - $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml

section.name: Shutdown and restart Tomcat
section.p: JES should be ready to run.
